questions.text: Changes in which of the following does not affect respiration?

The following events occur in the carotid bodies on exposure to hypoxia are listed in random order: (1) release of dopamine (2) excitation of afferent fibres of ninth nerve (3) depolarization of glomus cells (4) decreased potassium conductance through O2 sensitive potassium channels on glomus cells (5) opening of voltage gated calcium channels and calcium influx What is the correct sequence in which the above occur on exposure to hypoxia?
Acclimatization to high altitude includes all of the following except

options.label: B
options.text: Shift of OHDC to the right

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in the number of mitochondria

questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease in the number of mitochondria

options.label: D

questions.text: The receptors for the Hering- Breur reflex are located in which of the following?

Which of the following has an intranuclear receptor?

Most abundant anion in the ICF is
The most important factor which determines the movement of a permeant substance across the cell membrane is

The most important function of Na + K + ATPase is which of the following

options.label: D
options.text: Restoration of ionic balance after an action potential

questions.text: Equilibrium potential for Na+ is
All of the following are true about molecular motors except

options.label: B
options.text: They move proteins, organelles, etc from one part of the cell to another

options.label: C
options.text: There are three super families of molecular motors: kinesin, dynein and myosin

options.label: D
options.text: Kinesins move their cargo towards the ‘-‘ end or ‘disassembly’ end of the microtubules.

questions.correct_answer: D. Kinesins move their cargo towards the ‘-‘ end or ‘disassembly’ end of the microtubules.

questions.text: Depolarization phase of the action potential is due Ca 2+ influx in which of the following?

Maximum percentage of cardiac output is to which of the following organs?

Which of the following are present in the type I glomus cells?
The lung volume at the end of a maximum inspiration is
All of the following are effects of hyperventilation except

options.label: A
options.text: Arterial Pco 2 may fall as low as 15 mm Hg

options.label: B
options.text: Alveolar Po 2 increases to 120-140 mm Hg

options.label: C
options.text: Cerebral blood flow reduces by 30% or more

questions.correct_answer: D. Blood pH decreases to 7.3 or 7.2

questions.text: Cardiac index is which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Cardiac output per kg body weight

options.label: C
options.text: Cardiac output per sq m of body surface area

questions.correct_answer: C. Cardiac output per sq m of body surface area

questions.text: Decrease in ECF sodium has which of the following effects?

options.label: A
options.text: Increases the amplitude of the action potential

options.label: B
options.text: Decreases the amplitude of the action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Resting membrane potential becomes more negative

options.label: D
options.text: Resting membrane potential becomes more positive

questions.correct_answer: B. Decreases the amplitude of the action potential

questions.text: Given below is the myogram of a single muscle twitch. What is the tetanizing frequency?
Increase in sympathetic stimulation causes all of the following except

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in force of contraction of the heart

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect for La Place’s law? (T is wall tension, P is distending pressure, r is radius and w is the wall thickness)
The duration of nodal delay in the human heart is
If the radius of a vessel is increased by 50% flow increases by
At optimum length all are maximum except

options.label: D
options.text: Total number of actin myosin cross bridges

questions.text: The circuit shown below has an inflow pressure of 120 mm Hg and an outflow pressure of 40 mm Hg. Resistance in each of the four vessels is 2 mm Hg/mL/min. What is the total peripheral resistance of the circuit?
Shown below is ‘chloride shift’ in RBC. What is the name of the carrier protein involved in this shift?
If an artery is partially occluded by an embolus such that its radius becomes one- half the pre-occlusion value, which of the following parameters will decrease by a factor of 16?
Least conduction velocity is seen in which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Sensory fiber from golgi tendon organ

questions.text: FRC is the lung volume after which of the following?

The following measurements are obtained in a 30-year-old male patient: Systemic arterial O 2 : 0.19mL O 2 /mL Pulmonary artery O 2 : 0.14mL O 2 /mL Whole body oxygen consumption: 250mL/min What is the patient’s cardiac output?

Regional variations in ventilation (V) and perfusion (Q) are measured in healthy individuals when they stand in the upright position. The results are graphed with x-axis denoting the position along the lung from the base to the apex. Which of the curves is most likely to be observed?

The oxygen carrying capacity of a 18-years-old boy with hemoglobin of 14g/dl is
Calculate FEV1 from the below spirometry reading

What is the best way to maintain blood flow to a tissue?
Acetylcholine receptors at the neuro-muscular junctions are

options.label: C
options.text: Voltage gated sodium and potassium channels

options.label: D
options.text: Ligand gated sodium and potassium channels

questions.correct_answer: D. Ligand gated sodium and potassium channels

questions.text: Identify the correct sequence of the spread of depolarization in the ventricles

options.label: B
options.text: It is produced in alveolar type I cells and secreted into the alveolus.

options.label: C
options.text: It is increased in the lungs of heavy smokers.

questions.text: Identify the ions A and B respectively from the conductance graph of a neuron shown below:
Baroreceptor is which type of feedback?
Which of the following is responsible for BezoldJarish Reflex?
Respiratory rhythm generation centeris locatedinwhich of the following?
In the relaxed state, chest wall recoil and lung recoil are equal and opposite at which of the following?

On standing from sitting position a person has a fall in BP of 10mm Hg.After correction, the baroreceptor mechanism corrects the bp by8mm Hg with anerror of 2mm Hg. What is gain of the baroreceptor system?
Which of the following is a midbrain reflex?
Thirst is stimulated by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease in plasma osmolality, decrease in blood volume

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in plasma osmolality, increase in blood volume

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in plasma osmolality, decrease in blood volume

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in plasma osmolality, increase in blood volume

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase in plasma osmolality, decrease in blood volume

questions.text: Which of the following is a correct description of connections involving cerebellar neurons?

options.label: A
options.text: Basket cells release glutamate to activate Purkinje cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Climbing fiber inputs exert a strong excitatory effect on Purkinje cells, and mossy fiber inputs exert a strong inhibitory effect on Purkinje cells.

options.label: C
options.text: Granule cells release glutamate to excite basket cells and stellate cells.

options.label: D
options.text: The axons of Purkinje cells are the sole output of the cerebellar cortex, and they release glutamate to excite the deep cerebellar nuclei.

questions.correct_answer: C. Granule cells release glutamate to excite basket cells and stellate cells.

questions.text: After a road traffic accident, a young man is foundto have partial loss of voluntary movement on the right side of his body and loss of pain and temperature sensation on the left side below the midthoracic region. He is likely to have which of the following lesions?

options.label: A
options.text: Transection of left half of the spinal cord in the upper thoracic region.

options.label: B
options.text: Transection of sensory and motor pathways on the right side of the pons.

options.label: C
options.text: Transection of the right half of the spinal cord in the upper thoracic region.

options.label: D
options.text: Transection of the dorsal half of the spinal cord in the upper thoracic region.

questions.correct_answer: C. Transection of the right half of the spinal cord in the upper thoracic region.

questions.text: Late slow EPSP in autonomic ganglia is due to action on which of the following receptors?
All of the following are seen in REM sleep except?
What is filtration fraction?
Shown below is the time taken for adaptation by four different receptors. Which line most closely represents the Pacinian corpuscle?
Which of the following component of the basal ganglia secretes excitatory neurotransmitter Glutamate?
All of the following are true about circadian rhythm except?

options.label: A
options.text: Suprachiasmatic nucleus of the hypothalamus is involved

options.label: B
options.text: SCN receives information about the light-dark cycles via the retinohypothalamic fibers

options.label: C
options.text: Daylight causes an increase in secretion of melatonin from the pineal gland

options.label: D
options.text: Diurnal change in melatonin secretion from the pineal gland functions as timing signal to coordinate events with the light-dark cycle, including the sleep-wake cycle.

questions.correct_answer: C. Daylight causes an increase in secretion of melatonin from the pineal gland

questions.text: All of the following cause a decrease in the frequency of the alpha rhythm except?
The PepT1 mechanism for absorption of di and tri-peptides requires which of the following?
Complete transection of the spinal cord at the level of T1 would most likely result in

options.label: A
options.text: Temporary loss of stretch reflexes below the lesion

options.label: B
options.text: Temporary loss of proprioception below the level of lesion

options.label: C
options.text: Permanent loss of movement above the level of lesion

options.label: D
options.text: Permanent loss of consciousness above the lesion

questions.correct_answer: A. Temporary loss of stretch reflexes below the lesion

questions.text: Sensory receptor potentials arebest described by which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Graded responses depending on the stimulus intensity

options.label: D
options.text: Always bring the membrane potential of a receptor cell toward the threshold

questions.correct_answer: B. Graded responses depending on the stimulus intensity

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of nuclear chain fibers?

options.label: A
options.text: They area type of extrafusal muscle fibers

options.label: C
options.text: They give rise to group Ib afferents

options.label: D
options.text: They are innervated by Aα- motor neurons

questions.correct_answer: B. They detect steady muscle length

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: SCFAs are absorbed in the colon

options.label: D
options.text: SCFAs are absorbed by Na-SCFA co transport

questions.correct_answer: D. SCFAs are absorbed by Na-SCFA co transport

questions.text: In the formula for urea clearance, C= U x V/P, U denotes

options.label: A
options.text: Urinary concentration of urea in g/24 hr

options.label: B

questions.text: Maximum area of representation in a homunculus signifies?

options.label: B
options.text: High control and less skilled movements

options.label: D
options.text: More muscle fiber units present in the movement

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased precise nature of movements

questions.text: Which of the following is k/a diluting segment of kidney?

questions.correct_answer: C. Thick ascending limb of loop of Henle

questions.text: Which extrapyramidal tract functions like the pyramidal tract?

questions.correct_answer: A. log of intensity of stimulus
